chess

Interface ChessInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ChessBoard

    public interface ChessInterface
    Interface for the Board
    Version:
    October 19th, 2017
    Author:
    Tyler Solnikowski, Kanoa Ellis, Kayla Davis

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Player currentPlayer()
      Returns which player's turn it is, used when trying to move pieces to prohibit landing on their own pieces, as well as when switching player's turns.
      boolean inCheck(Player p)
      Method to determine if a player is in check
      boolean isComplete()
      Returns whether the game is complete.
      boolean isValidMove(Move move)
      Checks that user can move their piece to the desired location on the board.
      void move(Move move)
      Moves according to the provided data, Moves have a to and from location used to verify where they were and if they can move where the user wants them to.

    • Method Detail

      • isComplete

        boolean isComplete()
        Returns whether the game is complete.
        Returns:
        true if complete, false otherwise.

      • isValidMove

        boolean isValidMove(Move move)
        Checks that user can move their piece to the desired location on the board.
        Parameters:
        move - A move on the board with a from and to location for both row and column
        Returns:
        true if move is possible, false otherwise

      • move

        void move(Move move)
        Moves according to the provided data, Moves have a to and from location used to verify where they were and if they can move where the user wants them to.
        Parameters:
        move - A move on the board with a from and to location for both row and column

      • inCheck

        boolean inCheck(Player p)
        Method to determine if a player is in check
        Parameters:
        p - A player, Black or White
        Returns:
        true if the player's King is able to be captured in the next move, otherwise false.

      • currentPlayer

        Player currentPlayer()
        Returns which player's turn it is, used when trying to move pieces to prohibit landing on their own pieces, as well as when switching player's turns.
        Returns:
        either BLACK or WHITE from Player enum to determine which player's turn it is
